props.description: The underlying element to render â€” either a HTML element name or a React component.
props.title: as

props.description: Function executed when clicking the button.
props.title: onClick

props.description: Sets an icon element on the left of the button.
props.title: startIcon

props.description: Sets the state of the button as active/inactive.
props.title: active

props.description: Inner components displayed on the right of the button component.
props.title: children

props.description:
Controlled override for menu expansion state. This prop does not manage internal state
and is not forwarded to the DOM as an attribute. It is used only for layout and visual
state determination.
If not provided, the expanded state will be determined by the context.
props.title: expanded

props.description: It will be the accordion anchor and can contain all the props available in the MenuButton component's API.
props.title: menuButton

props.description: Required ID used to maintain correct component accessibility, it will be passed on to MenuButtonAccordion's children.
props.title: contentid

props.description: Changes the component usage so that control of open and close is controlled from outside the component.
props.title: open

props.description: Sets the state of the button as active/inactive.
props.title: active

props.description:
Whether the MenuButtonAccordion is expanded.
If `undefined`, it follows `MenuExpandContext`.
If provided, it overrides the context.
props.title: expanded
